alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 5:06AM MST until December 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills dropping to 20 to 35 degrees below zero tonight and Thursday morning. * WHERE...Wilbur, Bonners Ferry, Kettle Falls, Ione, Fruitland, Colville, Metaline Falls, Orin-Rice Road, Odessa, Schweitzer Mountain Road, Northport, Ritzville, Deer Park, Harrington, Chewelah, Grand Coulee, Sandpoint, Moses Lake, Metaline, Newport, Othello, Athol, Creston, Flowery Trail Road, Ephrata, Priest River, Clark Fork, Coulee City, Quincy, Eastport, Springdale-Hunters Road, and Tiger. * WHEN...Until Noon PST today. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Areas of drifting and blowing snow could lead to travel impacts.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
